#summary Short description of the samples files for Custom EXE

= Custom EXE Sensor Samples - Introduction =

PRTG supports the creation of self-written sensors. These can be Windows executables, WMI scripts, powershell scripts, command line scripts, batchfiles etc.

The interface is documented in the PRTG manual:

http://prtg.paessler.com/help/api_for_custom_exe_sensors.htm

= Details =

The custom EXE sensors can be found in the version control of the prtg7addons project:

http://code.google.com/p/prtg7addons/source/browse/#svn/trunk/Custom_EXE_Sensors

There are:

  * Powershell Scripts:
    * Demo Powershell Script - Available MB via WMI.ps1
    * Demo Powershell Script - Connecting to database with ADO.ps1
    * Demo Powershell Script - InterruptsPerSec via WMI.ps1	
    * Demo Powershell Script - Returns a fixed integer value.ps1
    * Demo Powershell Script - Virtual Machine Freespace of Datastore.ps1
    * Demo Powershell Script - Virtual Machine Powered On (V2).ps1
    * Demo Powershell Script - Virtual Machine Powered On.ps1
  * VBScript:
    * Demo VBScript - InterruptsPerSec via WMI.vbs	
    * Demo VBScript - Returns a fixed float value.vbs	
    * Demo VBScript - Returns a fixed integer value.vbs
    * Demo VBScript - Returns a random value.vbs
  * Borland Delphi
    * Load_Test_Disk_Write_Read_1000_files
    * Load_Test_Disk_Write_Read_1000_files_with_folderselect_in_param1
    * Load_Test_Memory_Allocate_And_Free_400MB
    * Load_Test_CPU_1_Mio_Primes

The load test sensors are described here:
http://www.paessler.com/blog/2009/04/03/prtg-7/testing-cloud-computing-performance-with-prtg-performance-comparison-of-amazon-ec2-instance-types/
